title: Hyponatremia
summary: Hyponatremia is a low sodium concentration in the blood.[4] It is generally defined as a sodium concentration of less than 135 mmol/L (135 mEq/L), with severe hyponatremia being below 120 mEq/L.[3][8] Symptoms can be absent, mild or severe.[2][9] Mild symptoms include a decreased ability to think, headaches, nausea, and poor balance.[1][3] Severe symptoms include confusion, seizures, and coma.[1][2][9]
